HE ATTEMPTED TO REMOVE THE TRUCK BY DRIVING IT OFF THE CROSSING, BUT BECAUSE THE FRONT WHEELS WERE LOCKED DOWN ON THE RAIL, IT JUST MOVED UP AND BACK ON THE TRACK. HE THEN GOT OUT INTHE CLEAR BEFORE THE COLLISION. THE HIRAIL WAS HIT HEAD ON BY THE TRAIN, PUSHING THE ENGINE AND TRANSMISSION BACK AND ALMOST OUT ONTO THE GROUND. IT WAS PUSHED SIX POLE LENGTHS DOWN THE TRACK.THE LOCOMOTIVE WAS NOT DAMAGED. ASSISTANT FOREMAN WAS TAKEN TO MEDICAL ASSOCIATES FOR POST ACCIDENT TESTINGOF BOTH BLOOD AND URINE. AN INVESTIGATION OF THE ACCIDENT REVEALED THAT THE ASSISTANT FOREMAN DID NOT HAVE A TRACK CAR LINEUP IN HIS POSSESSION AT THE TIME OF THE ACCIDENT.NoneNoneNoneNoneNone

20701-d-10-06-94-IC.Narrative: SHOVING NORTHWARD ON THOROUGHFARE PER YARDMASTERS INSTRUCTION, CREW WAS UNAWARE THAT BLUE FLAG & DERAIL HAD BEEN PLACED ON TRACK BY CARMAN. CARMEN CALLED YARDMASTER AT 3 PM, ASKING IF THEY COULD WORKON TRACKS 1A & NORTH THRU-A-FARE. YARDMASTER TOLD CARMEN "YOU CAN HAVE 1-A, BUT I'VE GOT TO PUT CANTON LOCAL ON NORTH THRU-A-FARE BEFORE YOU CAN HAVE IT." AT 3:35 PM THE CARMEN OVERHEARD THE CANTON LOCAL CUTTING OFF ON THE NORTH THRU-A-FARE ON THE RADIO AND ASSUMED THEY COULD HAVE THE TRACK. THEY DID NOT HEAR THE YARDMASTER TELL MENL HE COULD SHOVE BACK ON THE NORTH THRU-A-FARE. THE CARMEN PLACEDTHE DERAIL ON THE TRACK AND STARTED WALKING NORTH TO WHERE THE CARS WERE ON THE NORTH THRU-A-FARE, ABOUT 25 CAR LENGTHS NORTH OF WHERE THEY PUT THE DERAIL. AFTER WALKING NORTH ABOUT 10 CAR LENGTHS, THEY HEARD THE CARS GOING OVER THE DERAIL AND TOLD THE TRAIN (MENL) TO STOP ON NORTH THRU-A-FARE. INSTRUCTIONS HAVE SINCE BEEN ISSUED FOR THE CARMEN TO TALK TO THE YARDMASTER AT THE TIME THE DERAILS AREINSTALLED. THE DERAILED CARS WERE NOT DAMAGED DURING THE DERAILMENT, BUT SUSTAINED DAMAGE WHEN THEYWERE PICKED UP BY CABLE DURING RERAILING.NoneNoneNone

41025BOSAA-d-10-25-94-ATK.Accident Cause: Shoving movement, absence of man on or at leading end of movement
41025BOSAA-d-10-25-94-ATK.Narrative: A COLLISION OCCURRED BETWEEN TWO LIGHT ELECTRIC LOCOS AND ONE LIGHT DIESEL LOCO AT MOTOR STORAGE. PRIOR TO THE COLLISION, AN ENGINEER HAD REQUESTED AND RECEIVED PERMISSION FROM THE MOTOR STORAGE ENGINE DISPATCHER TO MOVE ATK DIESEL #410 IN AN EAST DIRECTION ON TRACK 22. THE ENGINE WAS MOVING EAST TOWARDS THE SIGNAL. AT THE SAME TIME, A LARGE EQUIPMENT OPERATOR BOARDED THE WEST END OF ATK ELECTRICLOCO #912. THIS LOCO WAS COUPLED TO ATK ELECTRIC LOCO #916. THE LARGE EQUIPMENT OPERATOR BEGAN TO SHOVE IN AN EASTERLY DIRECTION THE TWO LOCOS ON TRACK 24. MOVEMENT WAS IN AN EAST DIRECTION WITH THE LARGE EQUIPMENT OPERATING FROM THE WEST END OF LOCO #912. WHILE THIS SHOVING MOVEMENT WAS TAKING PLACE, THE EAST BOUND ELECTRIC LOCOS COLLIDED WITH THE SIDE OF DIESEL LOCO #410 WHICH WAS OPERATING IN THE SAME DIRECTION. THE COLLSION RESULTED IN ELECTRIC ENGINE #916 DERAILING AND DAMAGE TO BOTH EQUIPMENT SETS. THE ATK DERAILMENT INVESTIGATION COMMITTEE DETERMINED THE CAUSE TO BE THE FAILURE OF THE LARGE EQUIPMENT OPERATOR TO OPERATE FROM THE LEADING END OF THE EQUIPMENT MOVE AND HIS FAILURE TO RECEIVE PERMISSION TO MOVE THE ENGINES FROM THE MOTOR STORAGE ENGINE DISPATCHER.NoneNoneNone

41017BOSAA-d-10-17-94-ATK.Narrative: A SIDE COLLISION OCCURRED AT THE AMTRAK PROVIDENCE MAINTENANCE OF WAY BASE. THE ENGINEER OF AMTRAK EXTRA 538 WAS MOVING TWO LIGHT LOCOMOTIVES IN A WEST DIRECTION ON TRACK NO. 17. THE ENGINEER WAS OPERATING LONG HOOD FORWARD FROM THE LEADING LOCOMOTIVE NO. 538. THE ASSISTANT CONDUCTOR WAS RIDING THEFRONT PLATFORM OF AMTRAK LOCOMOTIVE 538. WHILE THIS MOVEMENT WAS TAKING PLACE, THE LIGHT LOCOMOTIVESSTRUCK A STANDING CUT OF 29 EMPTY STONE CARS THAT WERE PLACED ON TRACK 15 AND FOULING ONTO TRACK 17. THE COLLISION STRUCK THE FIFTH EMPTY STONE CAR (AMTRAK 11384) AND DERAILED THAT CAR AND THE FOURTHCAR IN THE CONSIST. THE AMTRAK DERAILMENT INVESTIGATION COMMITTEE CONCLUDED THE CAUSE TO BE THE FAILURE OF THE ASSISTANT CONDUCTOR TO GIVE SUFFICIENT NOTIFICATION TO HIS ENGINEER TO STOP HIS LOCOMOTIVE AND AVOID COLLISION WITH THE STANDING CUT OF EMPTY HOPPERS.NoneNoneNoneNoneNoneNone
